Description: Arabic inscription, tughra, one double knot, several '٧' marks with a line in the middle, all within a plain and a dotted circle. (obverse)

Arabic inscription; area divided into four by three horizontal lines, two middle quadrants connected at ends, one '٧' mark with line in middle, two '٧' marks, in thrid quadrant to left one double knot with letter 'ع' inside, all within a plain circle. (reverse)
Bibliographic references: BMC Oriental 8 / The coins of the Turks in the British Museum, class XXVI (511, p.173)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Hon Sir Charles Augustus Murray
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Isma'il Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt
